Key Arguments: The document outlines the rights and obligations of States Parties under the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights.
It emphasizes the importance of recognizing and ensuring civil and political rights for all individuals without discrimination.
The Covenant establishes a Human Rights Committee to monitor implementation and address violations.
It allows for derogations in times of public emergency but sets strict conditions for such measures.
Notable Quotes: Recognition of the inherent dignity and of the equal and inalienable rights of all members of the human family is the foundation of freedom, justice and peace in the world.
Everyone shall have the right to hold opinions without interference.
No one shall be subjected to torture or to cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment.
